Soups.Name: Aguadito
Soups.Details: Peruvian green soup usually made with cilantro, carrot, peas, potatoes and can have chicken, hen, mussels or fish. It also contains ají amarillo (yellow chili pepper) and various other vegetables and spices. The green color is due to cilantro. It is known for having a potential for easing or alleviating symptoms associated with the hangover.

Soups.Name: Ajiaco
Soups.Details: In the Colombian capital of Bogotá, ajiaco is typically made with chicken, three varieties of potatoes, and the Galinsoga parviflora herb commonly referred to in Colombia as guascas. In Cuba, it is a hearty stew made from beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, and a variety of starchy roots and tubers classified as viandas.

Soups.Name: Açorda
Soups.Details: A typical Portuguese dish composed of thinly sliced bread with garlic, much finely chopped coriander, olive oil, vinegar, water, white pepper, salt and poached eggs.

Soups.Name: Acquacotta
Soups.Details: Originally a peasant food, historically, its primary ingredients were water, stale bread, onion, tomato, olive oil and any spare vegetables or leftovers. It has been described as an ancient dish.

Soups.Name: Amish preaching soup
Soups.Details: Typically served preceding or following Amish church services. Some versions are prepared with beans and ham hocks.

Soups.Name: Analı kızlı soup
Soups.Details: Bulgur meatballs and chickpeas in gravy with yogurt

Soups.Name: Ash-e doogh
Soups.Details: Consists of yogurt and leafy vegetables. Served hot.

Soups.Name: Avgolemono
Soups.Details: Chicken broth, rice or orzo, and lemon, thickened with tempered eggs

Soups.Name: Avocado soup
Soups.Details: Can be prepared and served as a cold or hot soup

Soups.Name: Bacon soup
Soups.Details: Bacon, vegetables, and a thickening agent. Pictured is celery and bacon soup.

Soups.Name: Bak kut teh
Soups.Details: Consists of meaty pork ribs simmered in a complex broth of herbs and spices (including star anise, cinnamon, cloves, dang gui, fennel seeds and garlic) for hours.

Soups.Name: Bakso
Soups.Details: Meatball noodle soup in rich beef broth, sometimes include bok choy, noodles, tofu, hard-boiled egg, fried shallots and wontons.

Soups.Name: Barley
Soups.Details: Barley, vegetables, and broth

Soups.Name: Beef noodle soup
Soups.Details: Stewed or red braised beef, beef broth, vegetables and Chinese noodles. It exists in various forms throughout East Asia and Southeast Asia, and is popular as a Chinese and Taiwanese noodle soup.

Soups.Name: Beer soup
Soups.Details: Recipe from the middle ages using heated beer and pieces of bread; though other ingredients were also used.

Soups.Name: Bergen fish soup
Soups.Details: White fish (haddock, halibut, cod) and various vegetables in a heavy cream

Soups.Name: Binignit
Soups.Details: Coconut milk, fruits and tapioca pearls, served hot but sometimes chilled

Soups.Name: Bird's nest soup
Soups.Details: Edible bird's nest, an expensive delicacy valued for its unusual texture

Soups.Name: Borscht
Soups.Details: Cabbage and beet-based soup with meat. Often eaten hot or cold. A national Russian, Belorussian, Ukrainian and Polish (without cabbage but with mushrooms, served on the Christmas Eve) dish.

Soups.Name: Bouillabaisse
Soups.Details: Fish soup

Soups.Name: Bouillon (soup)
Soups.Details: Sliced meat, potatoes, sliced plantains, yam, kelp, cabbage, and celery. Traditionally prepared on Saturdays

Soups.Name: Bourou-Bourou
Soups.Details: Vegetable and pasta

Soups.Name: Bread soup
Soups.Details: Stale bread in a broth

Soups.Name: Brenebon
Soups.Details: Kidney bean soup served in pig's trotters broth, spiced with shallot, garlic, salt, sugar, pepper, nutmeg and clove. Mixed with chopped green beans, celery and scallion.

Soups.Name: Brown veal
Soups.Details: Veal

Soups.Name: Brown Windsor soup
Soups.Details: Lamb or beef steak, parsnips, carrots, leeks, bouquet garni, Madeira wine; popular in England during the Victorian and Edwardian eras

Soups.Name: Bun bo Hue
Soups.Details: A noodle soup from central Vietnam, with beef.

Soups.Name: Buridda
Soups.Details: seafood soup or stew

Soups.Name: Butajiru
Soups.Details: Pork soup

Soups.Name: Cabbage soup, kapusniak, kapustnica, zelnacka
Soups.Origin: Poland, Slovakia, Russia, Ukraine, Czech Republic
Soups.Details: Sauerkraut, meat

Soups.Name: Caldillo de congrio
Soups.Details: Conger eel heads, garlic, onion, coriander, carrots, pepper, chopped tomatoes, cream, boiled potatoes, and conger meat.

Soups.Name: Caldillo de perro
Soups.Details: Seafood, hake, garlic, olive oil, lemons, and Seville oranges. It is customarily served with sour orange juice.

Soups.Name: Caldo verde
Soups.Details: Potatoes, thinly sliced kale, with slices of chouriço added before serving.

Soups.Name: Callaloo
Soups.Details: Taro leaf or other leafy greens, usually with pork or crab added for flavor. The greens referred to as callaloo vary from island to island depending on availability.

Soups.Name: Canh chua
Soups.Details: A fish soup from southern Vietnam, made sour with tamarind.

Soups.Name: Canja de Galinha
Soups.Details: Chicken, pasta and lemon, particularly popular in the states of Minas Gerais and Goiás

Soups.Name: Carp soup [cs]
Soups.Details: Carp's head and offal, onion and vegetable. Part of traditional Czech Christmas Eve dinner.

Soups.Name: Carrot soup
Soups.Details: Prepared with carrot as a primary ingredient, it can be prepared as a cream-style soup and as a broth-style soup.

Soups.Name: Cazuela
Soups.Details: Clear broth, rice, potato, squash or pumpkin, corn and chicken or beef. Eaten in South America and Spain, it combines native and introduced ingredients. Pictured is an Ecuadorian cazuela.

Soups.Name: Chestnut bisque
Soups.Details: Chestnuts are a primary ingredient

Soups.Name: Chicken noodle soup
Soups.Details: Chicken, stock, noodles, such as egg noodles

Soups.Name: Chicken soup
Soups.Details: Made from chicken that's simmered with various other ingredients. Pictured is southern Chinese style chicken soup with mushrooms and corn.

Soups.Name: Chicken vegetable soup
Soups.Details: Chicken, stock, onion, green beans, carrots, potato

Soups.Name: Chupe
Soups.Details: Thin, milky seafood soup, also referred to as Chupe de Mariscos

Soups.Name: Chupe Andino
Soups.Details: Refers to various soups and stews that are prepared in Andes Mountains region of South America

Soups.Name: Cioppino
Soups.Details: Fish stew with tomatoes and a variety of fish and shellfish (Italian-American)

Soups.Name: Cock-a-leekie
Soups.Details: Leek and potato soup made with chicken stock

Soups.Name: Cold borscht / Šaltibarščiai
Soups.Details: Beetroot (or sometimes tomato), popular in Eastern Europe. A Lithuanian specialty, usually made in summer time in one varietiy, almost always cold. Based on beets, usually served with either hot boiled or fried potatoes.

Soups.Name: Corn chowder
Soups.Details: Similar to New England clam chowder, with corn substituted for clams in the recipe

Soups.Name: Crab bisque
Soups.Details: Crab stock and heavy cream

Soups.Name: Cream of apple soup
Soups.Details: Granny Smith apples, stock, cream, spices

Soups.Name: Cream of asparagus
Soups.Details: Onions, asparagus, chicken broth, heavy cream

Soups.Name: Cream of broccoli
Soups.Details: Broccoli, stock, and milk or cream as primary ingredients

Soups.Name: Cream of chicken
Soups.Details: Mass-produced in a condensed soup form, various non-commercial and homemade variations also exist

Soups.Name: Cream of Crab
Soups.Details: Pictured is Maryland cream of crab soup.

Soups.Name: Crème Ninon
Soups.Details: Base of a heavy stock purée of green peas and dry champagne

Soups.Name: Cucumber soup
Soups.Details: Cucumber soup is known in various cuisines.

Soups.Name: Cullen skink
Soups.Details: Smoked haddock, potatoes, onions and cream

Soups.Name: Curry Mee
Soups.Details: thin yellow noodles or/and string thin mee-hoon (rice vermicelli) with spicy curry soup, chilli/sambal, coconut milk, and a choice of dried tofu, prawns, cuttlefish, chicken, egg, mint leaves and cockle.

Soups.Name: Dalithoy
Soups.Details: Soup made with split yellow lentils and spices. It is a Konkani staple that is often served over rice.

Soups.Name: Dashi
Soups.Details: Clear fish stock made with kombu (sea kelp) and katsuobushi (smoked bonito flakes). Dashi broth is often used as a base for miso soup and other Japanese soup broths.

Soups.Name: Dillegrout
Soups.Details: Chicken pottage made with almond milk, sugar, and spices traditionally presented at coronations of English monarchs by the lord of the manor of Addington.

Soups.Name: Duck soup noodles
Soups.Details: The dish consists of ingredients such as duck meat in hot soup with mixed herbs and Bee sua served in particular at Penang hawker centres.

Soups.Name: Egg drop soup
Soups.Details: Savory soup made by pouring beaten eggs into swirling boiling water or broth

Soups.Name: Egusi soup
Soups.Details: Vegetable soup

Soups.Name: Ezogelin soup
Soups.Details: Savory soup made by red lentil, bulgur, onion, garlic, salt, olive oil, black pepper, hot pepper and peppermint

Soups.Name: Fabada Asturiana
Soups.Details: Dried large white beans (fabes de la Granja, soaked overnight before use), shoulder of pork (lacón) or bacon (tocino), black pudding (morcilla), chorizo, and saffron (azafrán)

Soups.Name: Fanesca
Soups.Details: Cod soup

Soups.Name: Fish soup bee hoon
Soups.Details: Seafood

Soups.Name: Fisherman's Soup
Soups.Details: Ηot and spicy river fish soup with a lot of hot paprika (Hungarian: Halászlé)

Soups.Name: French onion soup
Soups.Details: Deep, rich broth made with onions and beef. Often topped with croutons and gruyere cheese melted golden on top, over the edges of the bowl.

Soups.Name: Frittatensuppe
Soups.Details: Broth with crumbled slices of pancakes, also popular in South Germany and Switzerland (Pfannkuchensuppe, Flädlisuppe)

Soups.Name: Fruktsoppa
Soups.Details: Dried fruit such as raisins and prunes

Soups.Name: Fufu and Egusi soup
Soups.Details: Vegetables, meat, fish, and balls of ground melon seed

Soups.Name: Fumet
Soups.Details: Fish stock, often concentrated and used as a base for sauces, and usually made with fish heads and bones

Soups.Name: Garmugia
Soups.Details: Primary ingredients include chicken or vegetable stock or broth, asparagus, artichoke hearts, fava beans, peas, onion and meats, such as pancetta and veal.

Soups.Name: Gazpacho
Soups.Details: Pureed tomato and vegetables

Soups.Name: Ginataan
Soups.Details: Method of cooking using coconut milk. Due to the general nature of the term, it can refer to a number of different dishes, each called ginataan, but distinct from one another.

Soups.Name: Ginestrata
Soups.Details: Thin, lightly spiced egg-based soup prepared with primary ingredients of egg yolks, chicken stock, and Marsala wine or white wine

Soups.Name: Goat meat pepper soup
Soups.Details: Common ingredients are goat meat, crayfish, Uziza, Negro Pepper (also called Uda Ewentia or Enge) and nutmeg, such as Calabash Nutmeg (also called Ehu or Ariwo).

Soups.Name: Gogi guksu
Soups.Details: Pork and noodle soup

Soups.Name: Golden Mushroom
Soups.Details: A variation of Cream of Mushroom Soup

Soups.Name: Gomguk
Soups.Details: Beef parts such as ribs, oxtail, brisket, ox's head or ox bones by slow simmering on a low flame. The broth of gomguk tends to have a milky color, with a rich and hearty taste.

Soups.Name: Goulash soup
Soups.Details: Beef, pork, paprika, peppers, tomato, potato, and onion. Hungarian: gulyas translates roughly as cowboy

Soups.Name: Ground nut soup
Soups.Details: Groundnuts, also known as peanuts

Soups.Name: Kimchi Guk
Soups.Details: Kimchi soup

Soups.Name: Gumbo
Soups.Details: Creole soup from the American South, most popular in New Orleans. Often includes seafood, made with shrimp or crab stock and andouille sausage and thickened with a dark roux.

Soups.Name: Harira
Soups.Details: Popular as a starter but is also eaten on its own as a light snack. There are many variations and it is mostly served during Ramadan, although it can be made throughout the year.

Soups.Name: Hot and sour soup
Soups.Details: Soups from several Asian culinary traditions. In all cases, the soup contains ingredients to make it both spicy and sour.

Soups.Name: Íslensk Kjötsúpa
Soups.Details: Meat soup made with lamb and vegetables

Soups.Name: Joumou
Soups.Details: Mildly spicy pumpkin soup made with pieces of beef, potato, plantains and vegetables such as parsley, carrots, green cabbage, celery and onions. It is eaten every first of January in honor of Haitian independence in 1804.

Soups.Name: Kharcho
Soups.Details: Lamb, rice, vegetables and a highly spiced bouillon

Soups.Name: Kusksu
Soups.Details: Kusksu is a traditional Maltese soup made primarily from seasonal broad beans, small pasta beads - known locally as kusksu - and fresh ġbejniet. Although similar is shape, kusksu pasta, which gives the soup its name, is "not to be confused with couscous".

Soups.Name: Kwāti
Soups.Details: Mixed soup of nine types of sprouted beans: black gram, green gram, chickpea, field bean, soybean, field pea, garden pea, cowpea, and rice bean

Soups.Name: Laksa
Soups.Details: A Peranakan cuisine.

Soups.Name: Lagman
Soups.Details: Pasta, vegetables, ground lamb and numerous spices

Soups.Name: Leek soup
Soups.Details: Leeks and often potatoes. Popular during St. David's Day. Pictured is leek and potato soup.

Soups.Name: Lettuce soup
Soups.Details: Lettuce is a primary ingredient. Some versions purée all of the ingredients together, and cream of lettuce soup is a type of lettuce soup.

Soups.Name: Lentil soup
Soups.Details: Red, green, or brown lentils. Popular in the Middle East and Mediterranean area.

Soups.Name: Lobster stew
Soups.Details: Cream or stock-based soup with chunks of lobster

Soups.Name: Lobster bisque
Soups.Details: Lobster stock, heavy cream, and sherry

Soups.Name: Log-log
Soups.Details: Egg noodle soup (regional variants include Kinalas, Batchoy)

Soups.Name: Lohikeitto
Soups.Details: Salmon, potatoes (other root vegetables can be added such as rutabaga, carrots, onions), cream, and dill

Soups.Name: Lung fung soup
Soups.Details: Oriental Ratsnake[further explanation needed] soup made with chicken, lemon, chili peppers, and Chinese vegetables

Soups.Name: Lyvzha
Soups.Details: Beef, potatoes, onion, garlic, carrots and thyme, etc.

Soups.Name: Maccu
Soups.Details: fava beans is a primary ingredient

Soups.Name: Manhattan clam chowder
Soups.Details: Tomato-based clam chowder

Soups.Name: Maryland crab soup
Soups.Details: Vegetables, blue crab, and Old Bay Seasoning in a tomato base

Soups.Name: Matzah ball soup
Soups.Details: Staple food on Passover. The Matzah ball dumplings are traditionally served in chicken broth with sliced carrots, garnished with chopped parsley. Matzo balls are also referred to as knaidel or knaedle.

Soups.Name: Melon soup
Soups.Details: Soup prepared with melon as a primary ingredient. Pictured is a muskmelon soup.

Soups.Name: Minestrone
Soups.Details: Vegetables with noodles

Soups.Name: Miso soup
Soups.Details: Dashi stock base with dissolved miso paste (fermented rice, barley and/or soybeans). Common ingredients include tofu and seaweed.

Soups.Name: Miyeok guk
Soups.Details: Seaweed

Soups.Name: Mohinga
Soups.Details: Chickpea flour and/or crushed toasted rice, garlic, onions, lemongrass, banana tree stem, ginger, fish paste, fish sauce, and catfish in a rich broth. Served with rice vermicelli.

Soups.Name: Mote de queso
Soups.Details: made with ñame (yam) and Costeño cheese.

Soups.Name: Mulligan Stew
Soups.Details: Improvised stew, typically made with whatever ingredients are available

Soups.Name: Mulligatawny
Soups.Details: Meat, vegetables, and spices. Based on an Indian sauce recipe.

Soups.Name: Naengmyeon
Soups.Details: Buckwheat noodles in a tangy iced beef broth, raw julienned vegetables, a slice of a Korean pear, and often a boiled egg and/or cold beef

Soups.Name: Nettle soup
Soups.Details: Tender shoots of the stinging nettle, popular in Scandinavia and eastern Europe

Soups.Name: New England clam chowder
Soups.Details: Bacon, mirepoix, clam juice and heavy cream, with other ingredients such as potatoes and chopped clams

Soups.Name: Nikujaga
Soups.Details: Meat, potatoes and onion stewed in sweetened soy sauce, sometimes with ito konnyaku and vegetables

Soups.Name: Okra soup
Soups.Details: Okra

Soups.Name: Oxtail soup
Soups.Details: Oxtail soup is made with beef tails. The use of the word "ox" in this context is a legacy of nomenclature; no specialized stock of beef animals are used. At least five popular and unrelated versions of oxtail soup exist: a traditional Korean dish, a Chinese dish which is more like a stew, a fried/barbecued oxtail combined with soup variation which is a popular dish in Indonesia where it is called as sop buntut. An ethnic dish of the American South which traces its lineage back to the pre-revolutionary war era, and a thick, rich, gravy-like soup popular in the United Kingdom since the 18th century. Creole oxtail soup is made from a tomato base with oxtails, potatoes, green beans, corn, mirepoix, garlic, and herbs and spices. In Germany, there is a variety of oxtail soups (called Ochsenschwanzsuppe or Ochsenschleppsuppe) usually containing oxtail, various root vegetables, herbs, and also Sherry or Madeira.

Soups.Name: Palm nut soup
Soups.Details: Palm kernel

Soups.Name: Panada
Soups.Details: Bread soup made with leftover bread, eggs, beef broth and Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese.

Soups.Name: Panadelsuppe
Soups.Details: Made with broth, rolls and eggs

Soups.Name: Pasta fagioli
Soups.Details: Chicken stock, pasta and vegetables.

Soups.Name: Yellow pea soup
Soups.Details: Pea soup, originating with French settlers in Canada. Also called "French-Canadian pea soup"

Soups.Name: Peanut soup
Soups.Details: Made from peanuts, popular in African cuisine. Pictured is peanut soup (left) with fufu.

Soups.Name: Philadelphia Pepper Pot
Soups.Details: Beef tripe pepper soup

Soups.Name: Phở
Soups.Details: Staple noodle soup made by simmering marrow-rich beef leg bones and knuckles with star anise, cinnamon, clove, cardamom, coriander, fennel, charred ginger, and charred onion to create the broth, served with rice noodles and various meats. Pho Dac Biet, or "Special Combination" Pho, usually includes rare beef slices, beef balls, tripe, and flank meat. Pho is garnished to taste with thai basil, squeezed lime, jalapeños, bean sprouts, and sometimes culantro. Sriracha and hoisin sauce are also popular additions. Chicken, seafood and vegetarian varieties also exist.

Soups.Name: Pickle soup
Soups.Details: Various types of pickled vegetables, dill pickle soup is a variety of pickle soup prepared with pickled cucumber. Pictured is kidney and pickle soup with barley (rassolnik).

Soups.Name: Pork blood soup
Soups.Details: Thai cuisine; one version is called tom lueat mu. Also a part of Chinese cuisine, and was consumed by laborers in Kaifeng "over 1,000 years ago".

Soups.Name: Pozole
Soups.Details: Pork or chicken meat and broth, hominy, onion, garlic, dried chiles and cilantro, in a thick, hearty soup

Soups.Name: Psarosoupa (ψαρόσουπα)
Soups.Details: Oil-and-lemon sauce, vegetables, rice, and salt-water fish

Soups.Name: Pumpkin
Soups.Details: Pumpkin cream soup may contain some green pepper (Italian), red bell pepper, onion, salt and some oil. Rucola leaves top the soup.

Soups.Name: Ramen
Soups.Details: Fresh or dried noodles in a variety of broths with a variety of toppings such as various meats like pork or lobster, onion and other various herbs (miso), and sometimes even corn

Soups.Name: Rasam
Soups.Details: Broth made in various ways using different spices and tamarind

Soups.Name: Rassolnik
Soups.Details: Dill pickle soup. It usually contains groats, such as pearl barley, rice or oatmeal, potatoes, greens and herbs. It is either vegetarian or more commonly made with meat (often offal, such as kidney).

Soups.Name: Rawon
Soups.Details: A beef stew in black keluak soup that originated from Surabaya, East Java.

Soups.Name: Rishtay / Rqaq o Adas
Soups.Details: A whole lentil soup made with hand cut wheat noodles (similar to linguine) and flavored with fried garlic.

Soups.Name: Rumford's Soup
Soups.Details: Simple soup prepared with barley or barley meal and dried peas as primary ingredients that was utilized to feed impoverished people.

Soups.Name: Saimin
Soups.Details: Fresh, soft, undried egg noodles in bonito fish or shrimp broth with Chinese, Japanese, Filipino, Hawaiian, Korean, and Portuguese influences

Soups.Name: Salmorejo
Soups.Details: Tomato soup with garlic and bread crumbs

Soups.Name: Sambar
Soups.Details: Sambar, also spelt sambhar, is a lentil-based vegetable stew or chowder based on a broth made with tamarind popular in South Indian and Sri Lankan Tamil cuisines, adapted in each to its taste and environment.

Soups.Name: Samgyetang
Soups.Details: Chicken ginseng soup made with glutinous rice, jujubes, chestnuts, garlic, and ginger

Soups.Name: Sayur Asem
Soups.Details: Vegetable soup, sour and spicy

Soups.Name: Sayur Lodeh
Soups.Details: Vegetables stew in coconut milk based soup.

Soups.Name: Scotch Broth
Soups.Details: Mutton, barley, and various vegetables

Soups.Name: Shark fin soup
Soups.Details: Shark's fin, nearly tasteless, an expensive delicacy valued for its unusual texture

Soups.Name: Shchav, sorrel soup, green borscht, green shchi
Soups.Details: Sorrel soup in Polish, Russian, Ukrainian and Yiddish cuisines. In some recipes, sorrel is replaced by spinach or garden orache.

Soups.Name: Shchi
Soups.Details: Cabbage soup, a national Russian dish

Soups.Name: Seafood chowder
Soups.Details: Salmon, mussels, shrimp, and scallops in a cream base

Soups.Name: She-crab soup
Soups.Details: Blue crab meat and crab roe

Soups.Name: Shrimp bisque
Soups.Details: Shrimp

Soups.Name: Sliced fish soup
Soups.Details: Fish, prawns, and vegetables

Soups.Name: Snert
Soups.Details: Thick pea soup, eaten in the winter, traditionally served with sliced sausage

Soups.Name: Solyanka
Soups.Details: Pickled cucumbers, sausages, smoked meat, fish or mushrooms, olives

Soups.Name: Sop saudara
Soups.Details: Spicy beef soup contains bits of beef and offals (usually fried cow's lungs), rice vermicelli, perkedel (fried potato patty) and hard boiled egg.

Soups.Name: Sopa de Gato
Soups.Details: Simple soup, typically includes water, bread, oil, garlic, and salt

Soups.Name: Soto
Soups.Details: Rich soups based on various spice pastes, broths and sometimes coconut milk, often named by their originating region. Soto usually features numerous garnishes, including sprouts, sambal, crackers, fritters, and sometimes noodles.

Soups.Name: Soto ayam
Soups.Details: Spicy shredded chicken soup with noodles and a variety of garnishes which may include bean sprouts, boiled egg, green onions, fried onion flakes, chili sauce, compressed rice cakes, melinjo nut crackers and potato fritters.

Soups.Name: Soup alla Canavese
Soups.Details: White stock, tomato puree, butter, carrot, celery, onion, cauliflower, bacon fat, Parmesan cheese, parsley, sage, salt, and pepper

Soups.Name: Soup No. 5
Soups.Details: The main ingredient of this dish are the bull's testes or/and penis, other ingredients include lemongrass, thai chili peppers, green onion, ginger, onions, garlic and fish sauce.

Soups.Name: Sour cherry soup
Soups.Details: Hungarian: megyleves. Sour cherries, sour cream

Soups.Name: Sour rye soup, white borscht, żur
Soups.Details: Made of soured rye flour (akin to sourdough) and meat (usually boiled pork sausage or pieces of smoked sausage, bacon or ham)

Soups.Name: Sour soup (fish soup)
Soups.Details: Rice, fish, various vegetables, and in some cases pineapple. The term also refers to various soups in a number of national cuisines.

Soups.Name: Spinach soup
Soups.Details: Prepared using spinach as a main ingredient

Soups.Name: Split pea
Soups.Details: Dried peas, such as the split pea. It is, with variations, a part of the cuisine of many cultures. It is greyish-green or yellow in color depending on the regional variety of peas used; all are cultivars of Pisum sativum.

Soups.Name: Stone soup
Soups.Details: Pork meat products (such as black chouriço, common chouriço and bacon), red beans, and coriander

Soups.Name: Sup Kambing
Soups.Details: Goat meat, tomato, celery, spring onion, ginger, candlenut and lime leaf, its broth is yellowish in color

Soups.Name: Stracciatella
Soups.Details: Made by drizzling a preparation based on beaten eggs into boiling meat broth while stirring.

Soups.Name: Swedish fruit soup
Soups.Details: Typically prepared using dried fruits, and typically served as a dessert dish. It may be served hot or cold.

Soups.Name: Taco soup
Soups.Details: Similar ingredients to those used inside a taco: ground beef, tomatoes, chopped green chilis, olives, onions, corn, beans, and a packet of taco seasoning. Vegetarian versions combine beans with the other ingredients, except for the ground beef.

Soups.Name: Talbina
Soups.Details: Talbina is a soup made from barley flour, formed by adding milk and honey to the dried barley powder. It is called talbina, which comes from the Arabic word laban meaning yogurt (milk/fermented churned milk), because of its resemblance to yogurt, as it is soft and white.

Soups.Name: Tāng Fěn
Soups.Details: Rice noodles in broth, usually beef, chicken, or custom broth

Soups.Name: Tāng miǎn
Soups.Details: Egg noodles in broth, usually beef, chicken, or custom broth

Soups.Name: Tapado
Soups.Details: Coconut milk, seafood, plantains

Soups.Name: Tarator
Soups.Details: Yogurt and cucumbers

Soups.Name: Tarhana
Soups.Details: Fermented grain and dairy

Soups.Name: Tekwan
Soups.Details: Fishcake or fishballs, jicama and mushroom soup in savoury broth. Specialty of Palembang city.

Soups.Name: Tinola
Soups.Details: Chicken, sliced green papayas, malunggay

Soups.Name: Tom Yum
Soups.Details: Lemongrass, galangal and kaffir lime leaf, fish sauce and lime juice in the broth, often garnished with shrimp/seafood (Tom Yum Goong), straw mushrooms, hot chili peppers, and cilantro.

Soups.Name: Tomato bisque
Soups.Details: Tomatoes and heavy cream; basil can be added to create tomato basil bisque

Soups.Name: Tomato soup
Soups.Details: Tomato is the primary ingredient. Also popular in many countries, including Hungary (Hungarian: paradicsomleves) and Poland (Polish: pomidorowa)

Soups.Name: Tongseng
Soups.Details: A sweet and spicy goat meat soup, specialty of Solo, Central Java.

Soups.Name: Tortilla soup
Soups.Details: Fried corn tortilla pieces submerged into a broth of tomato and other ingredients.

Soups.Name: Tteokguk
Soups.Details: Tteok (rice cake) soup

Soups.Name: Turkey soup
Soups.Details: Turkey stock and meat, vegetables (typically onions, carrots, celery), broad egg noodles or rice

Soups.Name: Ukraine"
Soups.Type: Various types of fish, vegetables, lime, dill, parsley, and black pepper

Soups.Name: Vegetable soup
Soups.Details: Vegetables as a primary ingredient

Soups.Name: Vichyssoise
Soups.Details: Creamy potato and leek soup, served with chives

Soups.Name: Vori vori
Soups.Details: Balls of corn flour and cheese, often with chicken

Soups.Name: Waterzooi
Soups.Details: Stew made with fish (traditional) or chicken

Soups.Name: Wedding soup
Soups.Details: Green vegetables, meat, chicken broth

Soups.Name: Wine soup
Soups.Details: Hungarian: borleves. Pictured is a wine soup with bread

Soups.Name: Winter melon
Soups.Details: Winter melon, filled with stock (usually chicken stock), vegetables, and meat, which has been steamed for a few hours

Soups.Name: Zuppa pavese
Soups.Details: Consists of broth into which fried slices of bread and poached eggs are placed. It is usually served with grated cheese.
